contentheadline.headline: United States Senate Committee on Claims

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} The '''[[United States Senate]] Committee on Claims''' was among the first standing committees established in the Senate. It dealt generally with issues related to private bills and petitions. After reforms in the 1880s that created judicial and administrative remedies for petitioners, it declined in importance, and was abolished in 1947.
